item.title: Wynford grve 1st l/col in from saxville outage, 30th January

Dear All, still an outage, On Sat, 6 Dec 2025 at 14:19, Dear All, has been an outage for 2 months according to local residents,

item.title: Sharp bracket protruding from post., 30th January
item.description:
This bracket previously supported a down pipe, it is sticking out with a sharp metal edge. On Wednesday 28th January my dog run past it at speed and it sliced her side open. She had emergency surgery that night, I had to call a 24hr vet as it was 10pm.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cassland Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Disturbed Asbestos Guttering attached to the Garages, 30th January
item.description:
A health and safety risk is present in Rushmore Close BR1 2DJ due to disturbed broken Asbestos Guttering that is still attached to the back of the garages near to the public footway releasing micro particles of hazardous Asbestos that can cause lung cancer and other health problems to all persons using the footway. The Landlord has been contacted and has only sent a letter out to all Garage Owners to address this problem, however only one garage owner has followed this instruction, replacing the Guttering with a plastic material. Therefore this health hazard continues. The Landlord should get the works completed to make the area safe and forward this cost to the Garage Owners. This is a Health and Safety issue that requires urgent follow up, thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rushmore Close, Bickley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Double yellow lines worn away, 30th January
item.description:
The double yellow lines outside 100 Buckingham Avenue or worn away. Due to this cars have been parking illegally causing us to be unable to enter or exit our drive without driving down the pavement. We have requested wardens to attend but they have not issued tickets to the offending vehicles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Buckingham Avenue, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nr 161 Cleveland St, 30th January
item.description:
Temporary repair in 2018 not made good - runs along pavement on various patches. Pavement also has paint spills. Reported to WCC but understand that the maintenance agreement is managed by Camden. Location: https://maps.app.goo.gl/CazizzSk9JcCH9FE9 (nr Howard House, 161 Cleveland Street)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 128-134, Cleveland Street, Fitzrovia, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in the road o/s the labour party office, 30th January
item.description:
Resident reporting there is a pothole on Sidcup Hill opposite Church Avenue o/s the Labour Party Office. It has been there for at least 3/4 months, it is getting deeper and it is a danger for cyclists, the road gathers water in the rain as it just sits in it making it deeper & deeper. Please could someone look into this urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Church Avenue, Albany Park, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
